intro: Platycodon grandiflorus f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a cultivar of the Chinese bellflower. It is characterized by its striking white flowers, which contrast with the typical blue or purple hues of the species. The plant is a perennial herb native to East Asia, thriving in temperate climates. It features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped blooms in late spring to early summer. This cultivar is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
